document_notes.text:
This update for gcc48 fixes the following issues:

Security issues fixed:

- A new option -fstack-clash-protection is now offered, which mitigates the stack clash type of attacks. [bnc#1039513]
- CVE-2017-11671: Fixed rdrand/rdseed code generation issue [bsc#1050947]

Bugs fixed:

- Enable LFS support in 32bit libgcov.a.  [bsc#1044016]
- Bump libffi version in libffi.pc to 3.0.11.
- Properly diagnose missing -fsanitize=address support on ppc64le.  [bsc#1028744]
- Backport patch for PR65612. [bsc#1022062]

notes.text: Under certain circumstances, the ix86_expand_builtin function in i386.c in GNU Compiler Collection (GCC) version 4.6, 4.7, 4.8, 4.9, 5 before 5.5, and 6 before 6.4 will generate instruction sequences that clobber the status flag of the RDRAND and RDSEED intrinsics before it can be read, potentially causing failures of these instructions to go unreported. This could potentially lead to less randomness in random number generation.
